website_summaries.verdict: Although it's an inexpensive model, this digital microscope is compatible with PCs, Macs, and many Android phones, and can magnify up to a whopping 1000x.
pros: Easy to program and set desired brightness with 8 LED lights
Users are impressed by how clear the image is for such a cost-effective model
Kids like it for science-related tasks and older buyers like it for tasks like making jewelry and examining coins
cons: Although compatible with Macs, images will be reversed unless using Photo Booth

customer_reviews.title: Fun microscope for a low price
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting much since it was just going to be cheap microscope for my daughter. We first started viewing dead bugs we found around the house and then we were able to see a live baby aphid on a plant stamen. The stem was already very small, so when we saw something even smaller wiggling around, we were very impressed with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: zlajoie

customer_reviews.title: Best $20 you’ll spend!
customer_reviews.text: Really incredible little microscope for how much it is! I was between this digital microscope and a pocket microscope. My husband surprised my daughter and I and went ahead and ordered this one. I’m so glad! I love that we can all see what is under the microscope at one time. It’s simple to use. Just open the program it works with with your computer and plug it in!! Works wonderfully! We’re all out collecting things to bring back and take a closer look at. Here are some of the images we got.. a moth, spider, eyeball, and hair!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Baker Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Works best with clear cover removed
customer_reviews.text: For the price it works fine. The picture is way better when you remove the plastic cover, As I figured out on my own. Focusing is a bit tricky. Once focused on item ( coins for me ) I just leave it alone, slide coins in and out from under the magnifier. Can only see a quarter of the coin at a time. Need to try more ways of getting the magnifier up on a box, higher up and try focusing that way to hopefully be able to see the whole coin at once.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl M

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, scrap the stand and make or buy your own
customer_reviews.text: The camera is great, but the stand is terrible. Find some scrap pieces and build your own if you can. They also sell a stand for $20 if you can't. I think i did a pretty good job on the stand, i wish i could say the same for my first soldering job. :) No worries, work in progress. Once again, great microscope for $20, dont forget to take the plastic cap off the tip, and that thing on the side is focus, not zoom. You need an adjustable stand and bring the camera closer for zoom.
customer_reviews.author: NL AEIOU

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for price. IMPORTANT FEATURE NOT IN MANUAL
customer_reviews.text: Very surpsied by how well it zooms in amd the quality for the cheap price. BIG FYI it comes focused for up close zooming but to adjust remove the plastic flash diffuser and then zoom so that you see the lense point out. You can then screw out and in to adjust the focal distance!!! This let me put the camera like a foot away and still zoom in on motherboards to do repairs and soldering. Its an awesome camera for the price but the manual doesnt mention you can screw in and out the lense to adjust the focal distance
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW
customer_reviews.text: This is an inexpensive microscope. The real ones, used in medicine, cost upwards of $300, so... TIPS: 1. The stand is meant to hold the scope while not in use. 2. The zoom button has five presets. Press the button once to cycle through them. There is no graduation for zoom. 3. The software needs to be set up properly. (size of photo, length of video, where to store shots on your computer, etc.) in settings. 4. Double-click the 'Snap' button to take a picture. 5. Focus using the thumb-wheel. 6. Replace the cap to keep dust out when not in use. This unit is awesome for the price! The pictures are of a 1878 Silver Dollar, hand held.
customer_reviews.author: BeanBowler

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: This camera DOES NOT work with the iPhone! Company said they would send a WiFi unit to make it work with the iPhone but it’s been a month and it still has not arrived. UPDATE: the microscope stopped working the 3rd time I used it.
customer_reviews.author: eric westerlund

customer_reviews.title: Great Magnifier for Checking Monarch Butterfly Stages
customer_reviews.text: This works with my laptop apple computer. I like to be able to look at Milkweed plants and Monarch butterflies (caterpillars and eggs) at different stages. The magnification is great! It worked fine. It is suggested that people raising Monarch butterflies check the leaves for the OE. Ophryocystis elektroscirrha (OE) is an obligate, protozoan parasite that is a huge problem for Monarchs. I think that this magnifier will be perfect for my use.
customer_reviews.author: Pampooh

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price!
customer_reviews.text: The microscope camera works quite well. The resolution is only 640x480 but the image at that resolution isn't bad. Depending on the app, different resolutions are available through interpolation. By setting my phone to cast to my firestick I was able to present the microscopes view on a full screen TV which is great for a classroom while staying on a budget. I really like this device. Audio on my video wasn't good so I added music to cover the audio. I'm showing a quick view of the ability to cast the microscopes view.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory M. Ross

customer_reviews.title: The endoscope only worked three times.
customer_reviews.text: The endoscopy worked about three times. The cord was defected. A message from my laptop was can’t recognize the usb. I thought it was the disc that you have to download because I had to install and uninstall it four times. I had my husband look at it and he detected that cord was the issue. I wasn’t able to return it because it was pass the return date. I now have to take a loss.
customer_reviews.author: JANYETTA WEBB

customer_reviews.title: better choices around now
customer_reviews.text: It has good image quality and it is cheap. However, the digital resolution is only 640x480, the stand is awful (you can make it more usable by putting a bit of tape in the ball sockets, and the microscope is pretty bulky. The biggest drawback of this microscope compared to competitors is that it already starts at a 40x magnification. For only a couple of dollars more you can get a USB microscope that addresses all these shortcomings and is waterproof to boot.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: A disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had the experiences others had but sadly it does not seem to work. Software driver would not work on win 10 machine, on Samsung tablet all I got was blurry images. Yes I did remove lens cover and adjusted focus but it just could not produce a usable image
customer_reviews.author: K. SENG

customer_reviews.title: Would NOT recommend.
customer_reviews.text: The device i received is broken. Apps seem to tell its plugged in but cannot seem to get a picture. The screen just remains black, and yes led do work just not the camera itself. I wouldve rather had a dead led than the camera lens. Will never buy this again. I tried every app and followed instructions carefully. The fact its an amazon recommended item was crazy. The item felt cheap and directions were nothing short of problems. This should be "plug and play".
customer_reviews.author: Rodney L

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I have a Galaxy S7, launching the app gives one message "USBCamera2.0 keeps stopping, Close App." Useless for what I need it for. EDIT: Finally found an app that will detect it. The focus and take picture buttons do nothing. The actual focus is a comical joke at best. For the price it was a huge rip off. Buy it off wish for $1.
customer_reviews.author: Damian B

customer_reviews.title: Not sure why 1000x is advertised, as it's not ...
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why 1000x is advertised, as it's not even close to being that. At least it was cheap and I purchased other microscopes along side it because it has maybe left the case I keep it in a handful of times.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Woodward

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, my expectations were low, but not low enough. I was able to install the drivers and get it to connect to the camera. The stand was very light and flimsy. The zoom knob seemed to have a "dead zone". In between two spots, the camera would consistently freeze up and stop feeding a view to the computer. The "dead zone" was most of the usable focal range for this microscope. I'm trying to uninstall the program but it didn't come with an uninstaller.
customer_reviews.author: misterjman

customer_reviews.title: Poor engineering. Even on a budget. Pathetic
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this microscope, there was a short somewhere in the usb cable. It would cut on and off but when was running, I saw the micro surfaces at a decent pic quality but couldnt keep it running. This is on a brand new Samsung android too. So I figured I'd give em a chance and trade in for another. just another defect I suppose. Got the next one and this one won't cut on at all. May be these type c adapters. Too bad my phone can only take a C Type. Not sure about these things. Very poor quality. So yet another return. Not wasting my time and money with this junk again.
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: Defective garbage.
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to receive this and okay with I I was checking the mail all day long before it arrived. Unfortunately, it sucks, plain and simple. It stops working constantly. Its impossible to use it shuts off so often. I am so disappointed. The longest it has worked since I bought it was maybe 10 minutes before shutting off. I have even tried letting it charge for almost 12 hours before plugging it into my phone and it just sits there or the light on it flashes on and off. This microscope is garbage and I will NOT be purchasing anything from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: l.finley

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!!! How is this so cheap???
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for over a year and it still works amazing and produces amazing quality images. This microscope is so amazing and useful. I can use it for hours and still be amused. The pictures it produces are amazing, and you can even see details you didn't know where there. I'm amazed at how cheap it is! This is one of the best things I have purchased on Amazon, and I will definitely buy more for Christmas presents.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne K.

customer_reviews.title: NOT 1080 P, Broke after ONE SINGLE USE!
customer_reviews.text: I managed to use this to take TWO photographs of my plant's trichomes. Then, my laptop shut off, and refused to power on until I took it out of the port. I was confused, and plugged it into the USB port on my Desktop - It immediately shut off, meaning that the microscope had managed to SHORT ITSELF OUT in the 5 minutes I had been using it. I blame the janky USB + Micro USB adapter, never seen any type of USB plug that flips to show a micro usb port inside, this is just ASKING for a short circuit.
customer_reviews.author: Cali

customer_reviews.title: Don’t expect too much
customer_reviews.text: You probably realize this isn’t a “real” microscope like a lab microscope, but your expectations might still be a little high. For one, realize that this is VGA resolution (640x480) not HD like you’re probably used to. Considering this limitation, the microscope is decent but nothing amazing. It was apparently designed for circuit board inspection The software offers no real special features over generic webcam software so just use it with any webcam software that will recognize it. In short, as long as you know what you’re getting here this is a decent inexpensive product. My niece and nephew had fun looking at bugs and plants with it.
customer_reviews.author: Omega ManTop Contributor: Arduino

customer_reviews.title: Yes!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this microscope for $20. Didn't have high expectations giving the price. But I am impressed. I love this little thing. It's super easy to use and install. I downloaded the app and attached it to my phone with the cord it came with. The image shows up on your phone and there is a button on the microscope to take a picture at any given time which is then saved to a folder in your camera gallery and on the app. It can also be attached to a computer. I have only had it for 2 days, so I don't know the longevity of it. But if it doesn't last very long, I will update my review
customer_reviews.author: mmd

customer_reviews.title: More magnification than I need...but great!
customer_reviews.text: I have used USB digital microscopes at work and one problem I always had was light. Too much of it. This little scope has a great dimming feature that solves that problem. You have total control so your pictures are never washed out and if you have an outside light source you can turn off the camera light all together. Construction is solid, focus is smooth, and the set-up was easy after a quick assist from Jiusion. My software didn't load to my satisfaction and a quick email solved my problem. Good seller and good product.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy but no ios support, cheap stand
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly good camera on a useless stand. With microscopic viewing the tiniest movement changes the plane of focus so you are never really able to adjust without goobering the focus.. you may hit and miss a hundred times and maybe be able to record a sharp scene. It needs to be mounted like a microscope steady, wherever it tries to capture. I will see if I can put on a tripod or something but not being able to hit the snap button without changing focus is a killer negative. UPDATE 9/14/20 USB now will not stay connected after only a few uses ..using USB adapter to micro USB. Works if you hold it with pressure into the socket.
customer_reviews.author: Photographer AdvocateTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Picture quality is awful
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this to use for my nano shrimp tanks. I purchased another type digital microscope a couple of years ago and was looking to see if the picture quality and ease of use had been upgraded on different products. This microscope works but if you want to see the picture well you can't zoom all the way in. Needs to be in a well lit area otherwise there are shadows when viewing. The annoying part is the lighting on the microscope, there is no way to turn them off.
customer_reviews.author: Lovz 2 Shop

customer_reviews.title: More decoration than useful.
customer_reviews.text: It's a POS. With one hand you have to hold the connection while the other hand adjusts the zoom feature. By the time the image is clear; you have about a 1/4" - 1/2" of clearance. Can't fit tools in between. But none of that matters because you will never have those hands available to work as your other hand is still holding the connection. To top it all off is buggy as hell. If you turn the light to maximum it shuts down.
customer_reviews.author: manbearpig

customer_reviews.title: Good USB microscope for the money
customer_reviews.text: I was up and running with this microscope within just seconds. Plugging it into my Windows 10 PC, it was recognized as a standard USB camera without any additional software, or the included disk needed. And I could use the Win 10 built in camera app (Just hit start and type "camera" to find it) and was up and running. (if you have a laptop or main webcam already, choose the reverse/back camera button and you'll find the USB microscope) Good light sensitivity and auto-exposure as well. I'm using it for soldering small electronics and I definitely recommend the separately purchased overhead stand that's linked on this product's page.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew W.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I had no trouble hooking this microscope up to my cell phone. I just downloaded one of the suggested apps and plugged it in and it worked perfectly. The camera quality is really good. You have to put the microscope really close to the subject or it will be blurry. My hands were super shaky when I snapped the photos of hair roots and fibers from my sweat pants, but the microscope still took pretty clear photos. My 7 year son is going to flip out when he opens this Christmas gift. We will probably being it to the park and check out leaves, bugs, etc. A lot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for my application
customer_reviews.text: I used this scope to help solder some very tiny wires to repair a circuit board, wish i had one of these so much sooner! was able to capture video and photo as well without any difficulty. The stand is good enough, but could be improved if you had a flexable stand of some sort. viewing distance was good enough to allow for working without fear of accidently hitting the scope with my iron, around 4 to 5 inches above area maybe? i probably could have gained more distance with a better stand, but it worked perfect for what i was doing.
customer_reviews.author: Adam T. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Such poor design. App permanently messes up the microscope.
customer_reviews.text: Android app for this completely messes up color contrast etc and its impossible to get it back to original settings. All i did was click the button in the app because the app is so poorly done its not labeled, and everything got screwed up. Also, to adjust the zoom, you have to physically mess with the dial, because of the sensitivity of the camera, you quickly come off focus when you slightly touch the thing! what a terrible design! of all things they put the LIGHT on the cable for easy modification. what a really poor design. its not even worth the $20 just get a normal microscope or loupe.
customer_reviews.author: C. Birk

customer_reviews.title: Worth $20, likely magnification is about 10x to 40x not the 40x to 1000x they quote
customer_reviews.text: Very much enjoying this camera, though don't believe that you'll get the HD photos they show on the ads. you get 640 x 480 and it's a bit grainy, like high ISO. I had to search around for an app that would use this on my Pixel 4. I found a few but most had ads, search for OTG Viewer or Camera. I ended up buying MScopesPro to get rid of the ads, it is adequate. And on the magnification, if you could actually get 400x you can start to study cells, but you can't get anywhere near that on this thing... still great fun though, would just be nice if there wasn't false advertising.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron C Price

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time
customer_reviews.text: Scope does exactly what is listed, however; this item does not disclose the fact that in order to use it. An additional, software package has to be purchased it order for the the item to work. Don't waste your time. If you don't purchase the software very picture you take will have a copyright stamp across it stating the image belongs to the person you haven't purchased the software from. In my opinion, after I made the purchase all items I photo are mine. How is someone staking claim on something that does not even belong to them (the pictures I take).. Very dis-appointed..
customer_reviews.author: tralyn

customer_reviews.title: So much fun, but not easy to control
customer_reviews.text: I love being able to zoom in and see things close up. The difficulty is that to get the maximum zoom, you have to have the object right up against the lens cover thing - as close as possible. Then if you want other zooms, you have to back away from the thing you want to magnify as well as zoom out. This is easier when you use the stand, but if you are using it by hand (say, to magnify things on your dog), it gets very tough to get the right zoom at the right distance. Once you do, though, the images are clear and sharp. Oh, the things you can see close up!!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Cannon

customer_reviews.title: Great tool at a great price
customer_reviews.text: As a hobby I do repairs of home audio equipment. I'm frequently asked by customers to inspect their phono cartridge stylus (needle) for them. In the past I have done this with a handheld loupe which did a fair job but with limited magnification. This USB camera provides far better magnification and the added benefit of providing a picture to the customer. It comes with or you can download various tools from the sellers website but for my use a simple image capture does surfice. Note: Focusing at high levels of magnification will take some patience but it can be done. Very happy with the USB camera and the seller is very responsive to email support.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plug and play on macOS High Sierra
customer_reviews.text: Launch macOS native Photo Booth app and, under "Camera" in top margin, select "USB2.0 UVC PC Camera". Images are much better than I recall from a similar but older device which was supported only on Windows XP and earlier. The included stand is not great, but suffices for examining items held up to the scope, rather than trying to reposition the scope for items. Image quality IMO is good enough to justify buying their adjustable stand if an application wants better control of scope position.
customer_reviews.author: blekenbleu

customer_reviews.title: Clear images, incredible choices for resolution
customer_reviews.text: I was looking at Trichromes on marijuana flowers as inspection to determine the maturity. Worked excellent for this. I can adjust the light down quite a bit with the wheel on the cord, and easy to take pictures of whichever size image I choose. Would be nice to allow for saving last current settings, but always defaults to 640 x 480 for image size. Remember to create a folder in your computer where the images will be stored and then before taking pictures make sure that you choose that image location from the drop down menu of the program.
customer_reviews.author: Vernon L. Jenewein

customer_reviews.title: Must be close to the work.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first of this type of tool that I have ever purchased, so I didn't know what to expect. I am wanting to use this for SMT inspection and repair. One issue that I had, was that it seemed like in order to get a good picture, you had to have the unit very close to the work. So, I had trouble working around the digital microscope with the soldering iron, flux, desolder braid, and other tools. It magnifies great, but I will need to find something that will allow me to get other tools in there more easily...
customer_reviews.author: Brian H.

customer_reviews.title: ... have to say for $20 bucks this thing is awesome. I even got one for my friends kid
customer_reviews.text: I have to say for $20 bucks this thing is awesome. I even got one for my friends kid. I gave a 3 star because it does not have ×1000 mag. It only takes x400 mag to see cells and you can not see cells with this. Still worth buying though . Just look at my pictures
customer_reviews.author: Ethan B.

customer_reviews.title: LOTS OF FUN
customer_reviews.text: You can set the light level then focus in on your desired part of the object(that takes a little practice),then you can get snapshots at the click of your mouse ,or save video clips.The stand works OK for me.I have not tried this on a smart phone,just on a windows 7 desktop com.. Con: The snapshot button on the cam has not been that good because it moves the camera when I use it. Updated:the stand is working but could use an upgrade design to tightening the top part. Pictures are : AAA battery + tip,Cat whisker on computer desk veneer and 3 shots of elliptical turntable styli last on back-lit. Video of back lit styli.
customer_reviews.author: swamper

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great on my Moto Droid, for which I bought it. But here's the thing, I am 50+ yrs old and the directions said to email the company for a download, etc, and I thought it was too complicated so I considered returning it without even trying ...then my college son takes my phone and downloads an app and uses the microscope within minutes. So all I'm saying is that the bad reviews COuld be simply user error..or user duh like me! I asked him how he found the correct app and he said he just used the first microscope app he came to but it didn't work so he deleted it and tried the second, which did work. Kids!
customer_reviews.author: interplanetjanet

customer_reviews.title: Great microscope for the price !
customer_reviews.text: A colleague at work researched and found this to be very useful for our needs. We take pictures of circuit boards and the magnification range along with built in light would have done the job. While you can use the build int Camera App from Windows, there is additional software included. We've only tried in Windows but it looks to have support for Mac and even Android ! Juison has its own website for more support, drivers and documentation. Can't beat that for the price and customer service. Would not hesitate in buying other of their products, which they have a lot ! Thanks Juision !
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: This magnifying camera is a true bargain
customer_reviews.text: The included cable has a plug that fits regular "big" usb sockets as well as micro-usb, so the camera can be used with phones as well as PCs. An included adapter fits it to C-usb sockets, too. The image is sharp and the zoom works well. It really requires a stable assembly to hold it since the magnification is so great. I had to disconnect my webcam from my computer before this unit would work, although it might be possible to arrange things so one could switch back and forth without unplugging.
customer_reviews.author: Reading Chemist

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the price
customer_reviews.text: This has been an excellent buy for me. I'm using it to look at my trichomes and as you can see... It does the job. This is not at max magnification either. The led ring lights around the lense work very well, although lately it has been cutting in and out, when it works it's great. For the price you can't beat it. Takes surprisingly good pictures too. I'm very satisfied with it, a cool gadget that is super cheap and works better than expected. Hopefully the longevity is on par with the rest of it. So far so good, love it! I would definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Dan K

customer_reviews.title: Product and customer support are amazing ( Espesically for a $20 item ).
customer_reviews.text: I cannot stress enough how this microscope is amazing. I got a damaged one, likely caused by the delivery company, but customer service went ABOVE AND BEYOND. Now, the product itself works so well that I wanted to write a review. It is crisp, clear, and accurate. The software they recommend for the phone works, and the adapter they provide is awesome. Buy this BUY THIS BUY THIS. Seriously, don't be stupid and buy something a few dollars cheaper or more expensive. This is the perfect one. My 13 year old and 5 year old sons are currently in the other room using this to examine EVERYTHING and they are giggling and getting along. Its awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Bravo

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing little piece of equipment for the price wow! It's one of those things all kids need. The whole family and I spent 45 minutes at the table just tripping out on boogers, hair, food etc... 😆 The software is super glitchy though unfortunately. It crashes ALOT and so far, it only does still shots. Video is a crash every time. But man it's really more than just a kids thing. For instance I think you could use this for some medical purposes to communicate with your doctor remotely.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Drivers don't work for Windows 7
customer_reviews.text: Apparently none of the drivers are signed, therefore I can't get this device to a usable state on Windows 7. I've tried the version of the drivers on the provided disc, and the drivers located at the link in the Q&A section with no success.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew B.

customer_reviews.title: Very usable for price point
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with this purchase, bought it to help me examine some PCBs I'm soldering. See attached photo, I soldered a RPi Zero W with solder that was *way* too big for the job and a bad solder tip, I could not visibly see how bad of a job I did without this microscope. Had no problems also using this with my Pixel 3. On Windows 10, you don't even need to install 3rd party software, just open the Camera app that is pre-installed on Windows. Picture quality is decent but not great, but what do you really expect at something in the $20-30 price range.
customer_reviews.author: Sanborn

customer_reviews.title: Good, but image is unstable.
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this thing is great! I’m trying to learn to sharpen straight razors; many youtubers have these cameras and use them for this purpose. Setup is as simple as plug and go, no BS. The reason I’m not giving it 5 stars, is because at 1k magnification, it’s so wobbly that it’s not usable. I’m settling for a magnification somewhere in the middle of low and high. It’s usable in that range, but takes some getting used to. Perhaps in other applications, it’d be just right. IDK.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Fun with Family
customer_reviews.text: We have used this device on an Apple computer only so far and it works! We used the Photo Booth app and selected the digital microscope instead of the main on board camera - it just works. I was instantly testing it by hovering near my blue jeans and blanket and seeing the fibers so close - it was cool. We are still testing its features like zoom and my daughter was already using it to snap photos of different objects to make a game of "What is it?" I hope it works just as well on a windows computer and/or phone... I look forward to trying it. This helps piqued interest in sciences for my kids too!
customer_reviews.author: Waterfall Girl

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for studying my smelting runs. I like the built in camera and adjustable light, not a fan of the focus mechanism. I find it to really only works at minimum and maximum zoom but that’s onlywhile resting on the clear hood for support. The focus mechanism has a buffer but does want to drift slightly and the descending lens holding shaft will wobble on center, again making minimum and maximum the easier of the settings to use. Images are clear and of fair resolution, the included AMCAM app seemed to limit resolution, a problem the android platform apps didn’t seem to have. The stand is serviceable and I like the lens cover for storage. It’ll work.
customer_reviews.author: afartinthewind

customer_reviews.title: Decent microscope at a low price. Software and stand are my only complaints, but still great!
customer_reviews.text: For less than $30 this usb microscope cant be beat! It does take a little bit of patience sometimes to dial in the higher magnifications, but this is more of an issue with the stand than anything else. Would definitely buy again. I do wish there was better, more compatible software for Android, but AN98 works pretty well. I had a much better experience on Windows with the recommended software.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler J.

customer_reviews.title: Follow instructions for install closely.  If you are not computer savy, it may be a problem.
customer_reviews.text: I grow African violets and am worried about soil and leaf pests constantly. They are so easy to bring in on your clothes from the outside. This microscope allows me to see them clearly and with the photo, I can look up their photo and identify them. This allows me to treat them correctly. I am so please with this, now I don't have to take my plants downtown to the extension office for a review. When you have over 100 violets, going downtown could become a real nightmare. I love this microscope, the price was great and it is small enough that it doesn't take up a lot of space for storage. Buy this, you will love it.
customer_reviews.author: Sparkle Peck

customer_reviews.title: FAR exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: This is likely one of the best things I've purchased for $20.00. I was having trouble with bugs in my garden and wanted to determine which ones were the culprits. This microscope FAR exceeded my expectations!! I feel like a kid exited to learn about the microscopic things around me. Even just getting the detail of things that aren't microscopic is amazing. The pictures speak for themselves. I think the magnified fruit fly is the thing of nightmares, never imagined they would look so unnerving 😖! (No critters were harmed to get these images)
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: WAY more use than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this expecting to play with it with my kids every now-and-then. Now, though, I use it ALL the time. In the last week, I have: 1. Extracted a splinter (my 6 year old only lets me do it in the microscope as proof I'm not just poking her) 2. Inspected solder joints (and found a tiny short...) 3. Looked at a fruit fly being eaten by a sundew 4. Read some super-tiny text I've used it with a Mac, Android phone and tablet, and a Chromebook and would buy it again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: G.P.R.

customer_reviews.title: Mine must have been broke or its junk
customer_reviews.text: Not a good experience. Never could get it to work consistently, mine could have been damaged? The camera would freeze as soon as the on board light was used. The android apps are buggy and laden with advertisements. Phone battery drains super fast and gets hot. Installing on Windows 10 took some finagling in setting the default camera. Thr holder is not exactly sufficient as the camera spins when trying to focus. Spent about 2hrs with it and finally tossed it in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Works great, perfect for hobbyists!
customer_reviews.text: It's very interesting to see the composition of so many different things, it's a great hobbyist scope! I had no problem with software and/or connectivity with the device on both my windows 10 PC and my LG G7 thinq Android phone! The stand that comes with the scope is functional, but not really adequate. I bought the aluminum adjustable base stand to go with it as recommended by some other reviews, and hands down it is an essential accessory for the steady focusing and aligning of the target object. I found it quite a bit less aggravating than the included stand that came with the scope.
customer_reviews.author: A. ROGERS

customer_reviews.title: Nice novelty, better than I expected, but nowhere near 1000x
customer_reviews.text: For $20 I'm was not expecting much. Once you download and install the software (I'm using Windows 10) it takes bright and decent pictures at 640x480 resolution. The provided stand is nearly useless, and the magnification is 40-60x my pocket smartphone microscope rated at 60x-100x takes far more detailed and closeup pictures. -1 star for not including a download code for the software directly on the box and -1 for deceptive advertising. Still a fun toy.
customer_reviews.author: Josue Collazo

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for that's not always awful
customer_reviews.text: I got this after watching some YouTube video and thought it'd be a great idea to get a magnified look at my pores, hair follicles, etc.. I had a hard time getting it to focus using the zoom dial on the side so it was difficult to get a clear picture of what I was viewing, especially since I had to hold it because the stand sucks, but eventually I'd get to see the goods. For the price point this is still worth buying for kids or curious people like me wanting to look at weird things up close.
customer_reviews.author: Sir Angus Fannypants

customer_reviews.title: Very cool concept!
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty awesome. You can see the oils being produced by your hair follicles. Pretty amazing! The zoom isn't perfect and on most items only works at almost Max and almost minimum zoom. But never the less it's pretty cool especially for the money. The little holder for it would be awesome if it was adjustable and had a weighted of clamping base, but it doesn't and usually just falls over. But you can use it without the base anyhow. If you've ever wondered what the world around you looks like under a microscope, this is a useful and inexpensive way to find out!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Bad execution!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible execution. Meant to return but past the window. Extremely hard to use. Focus/zoom is in a very bad position as is the snap button but what makes it impossible is the stand will not hold the weight so the camera just falls to the surface of whatever it's facing.
customer_reviews.author: Thesweetness

customer_reviews.title: Bought it for my son, but I'm the one playing with it
customer_reviews.text: This little microscope is a lot of fun. While it isn't going to be able to look at things on a cellular level, it does provide some really clear views that you can't see with the naked eye. The stand is crap, but it's a lot more fun to just hold and look at things by sliding it around on whatever you want to view. The zoom wheel isn't actually zoom, but just a focus (for depending on how close the subject is to the lens). I'd drop the $20 on this again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Adam R. OQuinn

customer_reviews.title: 1000X Magnification, 10X better than I Expected..
customer_reviews.text: 1000X Magnification, 10X better than I Expected..Nice clear images. The software was straight forward to install. I already have 2 different cameras on that system and this didn't cause any issues or conflicts whatsoever. It's already saved me from hours of frustration and possible cardiac arrest during a system board replacement last week. It was the first ever that I had bent a few pins on an AMD CPU. Whipped out this scope and right before my eyes was a real time image of huge looking CPU pins. With a ridiculously small pair of tweezers, I straightened the pins. Couldn't have done it without this scope. Thanks huge!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Jones

customer_reviews.title: Apps for android are terrible
customer_reviews.text: First things first. This is a Very Cool item and works well! I love how you can snap pictures. The only issues I have is the Apps for Android either dont work, are not compatible, or crash often. They have several Apps for android so it may take a few downloads to find one that works for you. Another headache is the plug for your phone. It isn't long enough to plug in fully if your phone has a case on it. The 3 star rating has nothing to do with the quality but everything to do with poor phone apps and the plug.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: It's dependent on a camera app.
customer_reviews.text: It's dependent on a camera app, I had to go through a few just to really use the device. Not sure if it's the apps that are unreliable or the device itself. Got it for some fun, but it closed down a LOT, and I have to reboot just to get another angle, or another picture ..there was no rhyme or reason why it would just stop. Especially since I used it right out of the box. I held on to it a bit too long for the return window to close on me. Sad. I think $30.00 was too much for this useless device.
customer_reviews.author: Super Mom

customer_reviews.title: Not as great as reviews
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a small weekend project to look at microorganisms. The quality is awful at 1000x since it is digital zoom. The lens is protected and too far up to get close enough to really small specimen even on a slide. It is hard to focus and move around the screen especially when at 1000x. The same organisms showed up way clearer with a cheaper optical microscope that goes up to 120x. For looking at bigger, 3D objects, it should do well but the quality isn't that sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Howler R.

customer_reviews.title: So cool.
customer_reviews.text: What really blew me away was when I ran the scope over my skin and saw hairs the size of logs coming out on the screen. I can see where you could use this to photograph suspicious lesions on the skin and send them to your doctor. Such a great deal. Had some trouble setting up with windows 10, but somehow I got amcap to work. After receiving the microscope I was also offered a free aluminum stand which works really nice and a free carrying case. The aluminum stand makes focusing and zooming so much easier. Included pictures of whisker and wasp.
customer_reviews.author: MRCheshire

customer_reviews.title: Hope it lasts cause it's pretty cool!
customer_reviews.text: I'm waiting for this to break. Not because of appearance but because of how nice it actually is for such a low price! The scope itself is nice in appearance and feel and the stand that comes with it as well. The cord is neat with it's little flip up usb/mini usb connections. I am a little disappointed because anything near the 1000x seems useless. Once you zoom in a certain amount it's just a blurry mess so you don't really get the full capability. It could be user error I suppose but it didn't seem to be. Still happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Lebowski

customer_reviews.title: not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: No software available no zoom It is probably the 40x advertised at the low power but it stays at that. No zoom. basically 40X You will need a better stand, look for a cast aluminum one with a knob to focus it. You can't focus it with this stand After ten months he offered me a $50 guilt card to remove the negative post because he was getting so many he was about to loose his store. he said he now had some good microscopes so I offered to remove the bad review for a good microscope, much cheaper, but he did not have one so he lied about that too.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bodell

customer_reviews.title: Great microscope to play with!
customer_reviews.text: My young brothers and I had a lot of fun playing with this microscope. Sometimes hard to focus, but the image is great when in focus. We didn't use the stand very much, mostly held in our hand. The included ruler is very helpful to help focus. We had a lot of fun looking at leaves, mushrooms and other things found in the garden as well as our hair and skin. It is very fun and we just wanted to look at everything with it. Very pleased with the cost, ease of use, and quality of this microscope.
customer_reviews.author: PJR

customer_reviews.title: EDIT 10 Dec 2019 Company has new manufacturer. Offered apology & refund.
customer_reviews.text: Have Windows 10. Scope image will show on screen, but is not able to be manipulated or printed. Must download suspicious programs, and still does not work. Will be returning. Carson just came out with new handheld that will be just fine—and does NOT require unsecure program to work. E D I T 10 Dec 2019 The company contacted me with an apology, saying they have changed manufacturers. They are refunding my purchase price.
customer_reviews.author: Kwince

customer_reviews.title: The greatest gift for kids & big kids too!
customer_reviews.text: Great fun for children and adults. Fantastic value. However, the manual is broken English and useless, it would not install on a [newish] HP Windows laptop or a Chromebook. The "snap" button worked ONCE. It adds a time stamp. The "zoom" button didn't work at all. The app (mscopes) is pretty janky. But the microscope adds the "snaps" into Android's "gallery" simultaneously with the janky app. The quality... really good. The fun tou will have with kids or friends, or all alone... fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Caroline T

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love it but very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I'm really disappointed in this product because I really wanted to love it. Every time I tried to use it and plugged into my phone it would connect and disconnect and connect and disconnect every movement that I made. I tried turning it and moving the cord around but it would not stop, it just continued to do so. The image quality was pretty good but unfortunately it did not work properly and was definitely not worth the money. :(
customer_reviews.author: Geeka

customer_reviews.title: Pales in comparison to the Celestron
customer_reviews.text: This product is okay; however, it's ability to focus completely is limited. I was hoping this would be a more affordable alternative to the Celestron version that costs twice as much. Magnified images at all resolutions are not completely clear. Also, the stand doesn't have the ability to allow a straight down focus. Using this at an angle does not work for the items I want magnification of since they need to be laid flat. Spend the extra money and purchase the Celestron.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn

customer_reviews.title: No iMac support, no focus, and no usable zoom function.
customer_reviews.text: There is no means of focus whatsoever except to grab it and push it closer or farther from what you want to see. Also the zoom function does not zoom. It changes the focal point which means you have to shove it closer to what you want to see. They actually have writing on the lens and when you change the zoom it allows you to read the writing on the inside of the lens as well as see all the pre-installed scratches but it does not zoom in on your subject.
customer_reviews.author: K-R Lewis

customer_reviews.title: It's okay if you don't expect much.
customer_reviews.text: Installation is simple. Works with just a few clicks. The zoom requires a bit of effort which makes keeping an image in the frame very difficult. The button zoom is much better, but it only has a few magnifications. The light dimmer is on the cable so it makes it simple to change. The picture quality is less than I expected. Considering I purchased a mini 4k camera that is the size of a sugar cube with great quality, I expected more. It looks like a 480p picture that has been blown up to a 1080p screen.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cisneros

customer_reviews.title: Educational and Fun!!
customer_reviews.text: My kids LOVE this thing. Absolutely the best $20 I’ve spent since quarantine. My kids are finding any excuse they can to put different things under this microscope. Their recent fascination is with a scrape my son got. They almost immediately ran to see how blood and skin look after an injury. We’ve looked at hair, dog/cat skin and fur, leaves, rocks, blankets, clothes, human skin, flowers, etc. I can’t speak for the stand since we don’t use it. And FYI I found this because of TikTok LOL
customer_reviews.author: Keegan E.

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, high quality. new smartphone compatible! Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Awesome microscope for the price.. can't beat it! The light is a newer led type so it's super bright and helps light up every detail.. the focus wheel really spins slowly to assure you get it as fine tuned as possible. I was pretty impressed with how well it works... I initially had a problem with the C type adapter working on my phone... but after a couple emails and a few days later, I was refunded 2 new adapters and they both worked on my phone (note 9) like a charm! Great customer service, and quick replacement.. I highly recommend this microscope to anyone looking for an affordable, portable, easy to use microscope. Exceeded my expectations forsure!
customer_reviews.author: TJ Wood

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my needs and the cost
customer_reviews.text: There is a learning cure involved, but with practice you can fast at using it. Impressive capabilities for the cost. Of course they can violate all labor laws and ship it over here for free. I discovered newly hatched 2 spotted spider mites, forming WPM, Insect Larvae, nute damage and trichome growth very easily. Use Xploview software is recommended by me. Hate that I cannot buy this MADE IN USA...
customer_reviews.author: MichiganUSA

customer_reviews.title: How's your tricomes?
customer_reviews.text: Terrific little microscope! If you are using a magnifier glass or loupe, they are OK for seeing the pistils, but to see the trichomes, you need a microscope. I was using a hand held, but there was too much movement and my back hurt from leaning over. This kit includes an adapter so that the USB connecter will fit your tablet. You can record and take photos of your beautiful buds and get an indication of when to harvest!
customer_reviews.author: Dino Kat

customer_reviews.title: Very good camera! So so stand.
customer_reviews.text: This USB microscope works very good but the mount is cheap. You plug it in, run the camera app on Microsoft W10 and it works, 30 seconds more to figure out what the zoom lever does and you are done without having to read any directions . Any 10 year old should be able to get this working on their own in a few minutes and spend the next week looking at everything around them. The clamp is pretty bad so I made my own from an old high quality ring stand. I works with OTG usb from a OTG tablet (with is probably all of them at this point.)
customer_reviews.author: Ross K.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and poor quality photos
customer_reviews.text: This was very disappointing, the instructions to install are really awful. Thank goodness there were photos so I could work most out. CS very good when I had trouble and contacted the vendor. BUT bottom line is the stand is cheap and flimsy, the quality of the picture in just not good, only fair, focus is the problem....don't waste you money it's cheap and not worth it. Will return.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: No zoom or iPhone compatible but cool
customer_reviews.text: Camera connects to laptop or Android, not iPhone compatible. Camera has adjustable intensity light at end. It has a supposedly zoom adjuster, but it simply focuses. It gives no zoom. Might have to zoom in on the phone screen to get a zoom. It’s fun for kids to put bugs, like in the video, or dirt or objects on bottle cap and explore. For just $22 it’s a bargain. As mentioned in some reviews, the camera holder is kind of flimsy, but works ok.
customer_reviews.author: A to Z Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy and fun, cannot beat the price, super impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Finally took this for a ride during quarantine, spent the afternoon helping my niece & nephew find interesting things in the yard to look at. Very impressed with how easy it is, the simple focus mechanism, and the quality. On a Mac it's so easy to screenshot or screen record the images and keep them, the adjustable light is really handy, and the thing just worked so well. Absolutely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: schuss

customer_reviews.title: Amazing images!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting much from a microscope camera with this low price, but it has amazingly good images. If it can be held steady, the resolution is outstanding. The magnification depends on the distance of the lens from the subject. The base provided with the basic camera will hold it steady if a counterweight is placed on the side opposite the microscope. The optional base with adjustment looks like it would provide a much steadier image and better focusing capability.
customer_reviews.author: woodwringer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product!!!! I ordered one and it worked for 20 mins or so and suddenly stopped. I started a return and was contacted personally by the seller and they were polite professional and very concerned that I was not 100 % satisfied with my purchase and they immediately took care of it by sending out a replacement and it works amazingly well! Clear picture, easy set up with Android, quality is great! Highly recommended ! No issues since receiving it and I can finally see my coins with great detail!
customer_reviews.author: Mylicia

customer_reviews.title: Edited review: Jiusion customer service
customer_reviews.text: This microscope worked great for about 6 months before failing. The LED's died about 3 months in and the camera failed entirely a couple of months later. Got the job done for the short time it did work. Don't expect to get the most HD image out of it but it's definitely showing you a million things you've probably never seen. EDIT: Despite only costing about $20, the seller reached out to me quickly after leaving my 3 star review offering to replace the item. They didn't ask me to leave a new review but the customer service gets them two more stars. I have $500 dollar items that I can't get a reply on! Thanks guys.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: absolutely wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Overall this was fantastic, I used one of the recommended apps for my android phone (Camerafi) and I was able to zoom right in on this old medal. The first photo is a normal photo and the second and there photos are with this digital scope. Tt was very easy to work and performed better then my wildest expectation. It took the up close photos with my phone, nice and easy. The quality when excellent for my work. If you found my review helpful please click the helpful button, if not I will try better next time.
customer_reviews.author: John B

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad product for the price
customer_reviews.text: I gave this microscope to my nephew. He has a lot of fun with it. User friendly. On a Mac, you can use photo booth software which comes with the computer without having to install third party software.
customer_reviews.author: sirbullyak

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for the money
customer_reviews.text: This digital microscope is surprisingly good value for the money. You have to buy a stand for it (another $20) but its worth it. The stand makes it so much easier to focus and zoom. I've been able to see surprisingly good detail with it when inspecting metal parts for me or looking at bugs , leaves, etc with my two girls. The software with it is basic but nice. You can do angle measurements which I needed and so was impressed. It is a recommended buy by me.
customer_reviews.author: Pc

customer_reviews.title: I can see again
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, this is a great little camera that is easy to use on my PC and on my cell phone. I can see all sorts of small things and verify the fit of small assemblies. Until I needed it, I didn't know I needed it. Their website is very useful, I was able to download the drivers and files I needed. I recommend this to any experimenter or to kids who like exploring small things.
customer_reviews.author: P. Altenburg

customer_reviews.title: I'm surprised!
customer_reviews.text: Bought on a whim as a last-minute Christmas gift and have been surprised at how much it's been used! Installation would have been easier if I'd checked the privacy settings on Windows 10 to be sure the camera wasn't blocked. :) Have yet to get the zoom button to work with amcap, but other than that, works great! Will be getting the upgraded stand as others have mentioned. Fun!!
customer_reviews.author: Jscris

customer_reviews.title: Camera microscope rules
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. The program/driver "amcap" that came with camera didn't work on my win10 computer, but an email from seller with link to program online worked fine. I scored this product a 5 because the sellers communication was excellent, I actually didn't even have to ask for link to driver, it was in a "follow up" e-mail from seller. I scored the picture quality, camera quality at 4 only because its not 10mp or 4k resolution, but the picks are as clear as your ability to focus, we are talking microscopic pics ya know. Very satisfied customer, and only 20 bucks woohoo
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Lee

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective
customer_reviews.text: I was able to use this with little effort to use this microscope. It is very easy to snap pictures and adjust the focus. The USB adapter that comes with it has the ability to be converted directly into a micro USB and also came with a handy USB => USB C adapter. The only downside that I have encountered is the stand, which at certain angles is a bit top-heavy. It doesn't warrant a lower star since I found it very easy to counterweight the base and it doesn't take away from the end product, which is EXCELLENT for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Ciancio

customer_reviews.title: Use for work on SMD device test...
customer_reviews.text: As indicated I bought this device (and stand) for use at work in device testing. The ZOOM and SNAP buttons don't work - HOWEVER I also don't have all the drivers installed at this time. So that's on me. Focus and lamp work great. I had a previous device like this that I installed a switch and pot for the built-in LED illuminator-ring as some targets are hard to see with the blinding white LED array. THIS device comes with a dimmer from full to zero illumination on the cable! Most Excellent! Tested with Android and Windows 10 - 5 Stars!
customer_reviews.author: ericjbrewer

customer_reviews.title: Very Handy
customer_reviews.text: What a great little item almost ready to use straight out of the box. I had to download to my laptop a couple of different times but I got it working and use it for lots of things like coins, jewelry, and anything I that I can't see which these days is a lot. The stand could be better but for the price point I made do. If your looking for a way to see that teeny, tiny whatever it maybe this will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Hillbillyland_Chix

customer_reviews.title: Good deal. Fun to use.
customer_reviews.text: Great deal for the price. Picture is not very clear at high zoom. Color quality is not great, but picture at 40+ to maybe 100 is good. Zoom is continuous, so it has to be inferred with the overlay ruler. Unfortunately the thickness of the plastic template precludes one from zooming in on the object and the template at the same time. The stand is a little wobbly so focus takes a bit more effort than I would want. Not as easy as my old microscope. But now I can take pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Zarus

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, amazing video, super high definition!
customer_reviews.text: The first camera I received had a software issue and I tried everything I could to get the zoom function to work, to no avail. Fortunately the seller stuck with me and tried to solve my issue. Upon receiving another camera from them I immediately got the replacement camera to work perfectly! It works beautifully and I want to thank the seller for all their help. This camera is worth way more than what they sell it for! 😎
customer_reviews.author: John Court

customer_reviews.title: This microscope is well worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I love this microscope, the magnification is awesome and the zoom makes it even more so incredible. I tried 2 other more expensive digital microscopes prior to this one and sent them both back. This one is a keeper and I would highly recommend it. The only improvement I would recommend for this microscope is the stand that comes with it. The microscope itself is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Worth $20 easily
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with this, only have it 4 stars because snapping a photo and zooming is so clumsy. The stand is near useless, so it has to be handheld, as soon as you try to take a photo by pressing in the snap button, the whole device moves and the whatever you were trying to photograph is gone, same issue with zoom. But for $20 it is a fantastic deal, very happy with my purchase. Pictures are of a Spirulina culture, and a kombucha scoby
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: Don't work with USB C
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work with my Note 8 even though they included the USB C adapter! The camera light would flash when you plug it into your phone, and if you turn the plug upside down then the light would go off. But it did work my friends note 4. :()
customer_reviews.author: HumanTesting

product_meta.title: Jiusion 40 to 1000x Magnification Endoscope, 8 LED USB 2.0 Digital Microscope, Mini Camera with OTG Adapter and Metal Stand, Compatible with Mac Window 7 8 10 Android Linux
product_meta.description:
Note: Focus Wheel can be used on ALL devices. But SNAP and ZOOM button can only be recognize on Windows system as the software was written by our company, and android APP (mac system doesn’t need software) is common in the market so it can’t recognize the SNAP and ZOOM command. 

Window User 
Amcap is a professional window software designed for window xp/vista/7/8/10. You can get the package from CD or contract us for the downloading link. 

Mac User 
Mac users can use the Photo Booth to use this microscope directly. There is software called “Quick Camera” which can work on this microscope too. 

Android User 
Please scan the code above or search “OTG Viewer” on google play to get the app installation. 

Chrome OS 
This microscopes can be used with the default Camera app that comes with Chrome. 

Linux 
Raspberry Pi: Working with the current version of Raspbian Jessie. 

Parameters: 
Focus Range: from 1mm to 90mm 
Frame Rate: Max 30f/s under 600 Lux Brightness 
Magnification Ratio: 40x to 1000x 
Video format: AVI 
Photo format: JPEG or BMP 
Light source: 8 LED (adjustable by control wheel) 
PC interface: USB2.0 
Power source: 5V DC from USB port 
Operation system: Windows 7 8 10/Vista/XP/2000, Mac OS X 10.5 or above, some of Android mobiles, Linux, Chrome(not supported for iPhone/iPad) 
Bundle software: MicroCapture with measurement & calibration function 
System Requirement Pentium Computet with 700M Hz &Above, 20M HD Space 
CD ROM Measure Tool: Micro-Measure (It can measure Length and diameters, angle, the perimeter, area, etc on Windows) 
Color: Black 

Package including: 
1x USB/MicroUSB 2in1 Microscope 
1x Type C adapter 
1x Metal Tripod 
1x CD Driver 
1x Ruler 
1x Instruction
feature_bullets: Jiusion portable magnification is a useful and funny microscope for students, engineers, inventors, and others who need to magnify and explore the micro things.
Be compatible with Mac, Window XP and above, Linux. This microscope isn't compatible with iPhone/iPad.
This magnification only support Android smartphone which has OTG function.(How to Check OTG? Download the free app”USB OTG Checker”)
Built-in 8 LED lights, digital microscope’s 2 adjusting knob can change the focus and brightness.

Connected to the devices, you can use the software to record the micro world, capture screenshot and record video. Besides you can use the Windows software’s measurement function to measure the least bit.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars6,306 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
